item.name: Crimson Ladle
item.text:
Once per day, you may use this ornate red-enameled ladle to sit any liquid. When stirred for 1 minute, the liquid becomes magically enhanced. The next creature to drink from it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by the attuned user for 1 hour. The effect ends early if the target is harmed.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly (Sinister Cult) p. 30 (Third Party)

item.name: Reliquary of Withered Tongues
item.text:
This grotesque amulet consists of withered tongues suspended in glistening amber and wired into a lattice of black brass. Whispered echoes of forgotten sermons reverberate faintly from its core. While attuned, you can cast Command and Suggestion once per day each without expanding a spell slot. When you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a Charisma or Wisdom saving throw, you can impose disadvantage on the roll. Once used, this feature can't be used again until you finish a long rest. If you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell, the reliquary hisses a phrase in an unknown language. You gain temporary hit points equal to twice your spellcasting ability modifier. Whenever a creature within 60 ft. of you succeeds on a saving throw against one of your enchantment or illusion spells, you can use your reaction to force them to make an Intelligence saving throw (DC 16). On a failure, they are silenced until the start of their next turn as their tongue feels withered and numb. This feature can be used once per long rest.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly (Sinister Cult) p. 30 (Third Party)

item.name: The Apostate's Brand
item.text:
This black iron ring sears itself into the wearer's finger, leaving a visible brand that flickers with ghostly runes. Once attuned, it cannot be removed short of a Wish spell.
You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC.
When you cast a spell that charms or frightens a creature, that creature takes 3d6 psychic damage if it fails its saving throw. If a creature dies while charmed or frightened by you, you regain one expended spell slot of 5th level or lower. Once per long rest, you can cast Mass Suggestion without expending a spell slot. The spell requires no verbal components when cast this way. While attuned to the brand, your creature type counts as Fiend in addition to your own.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly (Sinister Cult) p. 30 (Third Party)

item.name: Vowpiercer
item.text:
This thin black dagger is carved from obsidian and wrapped in silver thread. It vibrates slightly in the presence of secrets or broken promises.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon.
When you hit a creature that has lied within the past hour; the dagger deals an extra 1d6 psychic damage. Once per long rest, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this dagger, you can whisper a vow into its ear. For the next 24 hours, you have advantage on checks to track or locate its allies.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly (Sinister Cult) p. 31 (Third Party)
